Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2007 07:16PM JoyRebecca wrote: Hi all, I have mets to several areas in my spine. I take enteric coated aspirin and alternate that with darvocet. Usually 1 darvocet will do it and it doesn't make me loopy. Sometimes I use ibuprofen for the pain instead of aspirin. The over the counter pills come as 200mg.The prescription strength is 800mg....so 4 over the couters do it. Caution...must eat first!! And know that aspirin thins the blood. But it's anti-inflammatory effects really help!

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2008 10:50AM JoyRebecca wrote: Zar, I've not been on the boards lately...it just became too difficult and I know the blue funk that you're feeling right now. Answer to your question: God DOES hear our prayers. He doesn't wave His magic wand and make things happen the way we want every time, But He does hear and is the ultimate support and will always be there to lift you up if you allow Him to. Why do we have to suffer???...Well, I guess someone has to , and it might as well be us. But when you really think about it, EVERYONE suffers throughout this life. And it's really not a pissin' contest...like "My suffer is worse than yours." I mean, we all have our crosses.  Look at the soldiers in Iraq and Afghanistan...what they wouldn't give to not taste sand for just 1 day.  Or the mother that loses her baby at birth...what she wouldn't give for just 1 day of sweet baby smells and hugs. Or the person that goes to the store and gets in a fatal wreck...what they would give for just 1 day to make ends right. Or my friend, Mike, 32 yrs old , who came home from work, laid down on the couch and died from a massive heart attack...just 1 more day. The way I choose to look at why I have to go through this is that I am so lucky that I HAVE that 1 more day to do my very best to let the loved ones in my life KNOW how much I love them, and try to be my best so that I can leave this Earth in peace and in the meantime, try to atone for things I wish I would have done differently. I know that you will come to terms, although what a hard road that is. I know you will do it because of your children...because they will live your legacy. You'll work through this and come to peace with yourself and your God. In the meantime, I'll be thinking of you, and praying for you, and be here when you falter. XX Joy

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2007 11:10AM JoyRebecca wrote: Hi Topaz, Yes,it's a pretty crazy ride here at Club Mets. I'm so sorry that you're joining us.I can remember the stark terror when I joined. I'm happy to tell you that the ride starts out rough, but does seem to smooth out on down the line.Once treatment is planned and started you're going to feel a whole lot better. I have spinal mets and radiation helped immensley with the pain.I don't think paralysis ever entered my mind.I know my Rad Onc was very meticulous because of the spinal cord. I applied for SSDI immediately and it took 6 mos. but I'm glad that I did.I identify with how you feel about work.Quite frankly, I don't miss the work at all but I miss the people.I was ready to get out of the rat race anyhow.I know that my back would not have allowed me to return.If I feel well enough and need to get out and be useful, I can always volunteer! Yep, it's hard on the people who love you.I feel I owe my sons and DH the best fight with the best attitude that I can muster!
